docs.snippet: Mohanbhai Ramchandani, suit maker for famous athletes, confessed to tax evasion and agreed to spend 1 to 3 years in prison and pay $5.5 million in back taxes and penalties....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mohanbhai Ramchandani, suit maker for famous athletes, confessed to tax evasion and agreed to spend 1 to 3 years in prison and pay $5.5 million in back taxes and penalties.
docs.abstract: Tailor Mohanbhai Ramchandani admits to collecting $1.7 million in taxes from customers that he did not pay and to underpaying his personal income taxes by $256,000; pleads guilty to tax evasion charges in State Supreme Court in Manhattan and agrees to serve prison sentence of one to three years and pay $5.5 million in back taxes an penalties.

headline.seo: Tailor Who Outfitted Athletes Admits Cheating on Taxes
headline.main: A Tailor Admits Underpaying on His Taxes by the Millions
headline.print_headline: A Tailor Admits Underpaying On His Taxes By the Millions

docs.snippet: Bolstered by support from China, the United States introduced a draft resolution on Tuesday that would intensify sanctions on North Korea because of its nuclear test last month....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bolstered by support from China, the United States introduced a draft resolution on Tuesday that would intensify sanctions on North Korea because of its nuclear test last month.
docs.abstract: United States, bolstered by support from China, introduces draft resolution that would intensify sanctions on North Korea because of its nuclear test in February; measure, which will be fourth United Nations Security Council sanctions resolution on North Korea, seems assured of passage due to China's support.

headline.seo: U.N. Resolution Aims at North Korean Banks and Diplomats
headline.main: U.N. Resolution to Aim at North Korean Banks and Diplomats
headline.print_headline: U.N. Resolution Aims At North Korean Banks
